description.en: The architecture of intelligence flow that enables structured knowledge to remain coherent as it moves across agents, contexts, and time.

definition.en: How structured intelligence flows through recursive loops of creation, structuring, publishing, retrieval, and evolution while maintaining coherence across transformations.

principles.name: Circulation Integrity
principles.description: Intelligence must maintain semantic integrity as it flows across contexts, requiring architectural boundaries that preserve meaning during transitions.

principles.name: Recursive Loops
principles.description: Intelligence improves through structured feedback loops that allow it to build upon itself rather than merely accumulate.

principles.name: Structural Coherence
principles.description: As intelligence moves across boundaries, its structural architecture must maintain coherence while adapting to new contexts.

principles.name: Transitional Protocols
principles.description: Clear mechanisms are needed for intelligence to move between human cognition, organizational structures, and machine systems.

principles.name: Flow Dynamics
principles.description: Pattern recognition of resistance, friction, and acceleration in intelligence circulation enables optimization of knowledge flow.
